description: Quick and easy Cauliflower Alfredo that's rich, creamy, delicious, and really low in fat! It's a great, healthy and lightened-up alternative to traditional Alfredo sauce.
keywords: cauliflower alfredo, cauliflower alfredo recipe, dairy-free alfredo recipe, healthy alfredo recipe, vegan alfredo, vegan alfredo recipe
name: Cauliflower Alfredo
recipeIngredient: 1/2 medium (350g / 12 oz) cauliflower (, florets and stalks)
1 small onion (, finely chopped (roughly golf ball size)
1 teaspoon fine sea salt (, plus more to taste)
1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper (, plus more to taste)
1/4 teaspoon smoked paprika (, or chipotle powder )
1 tablespoon olive oil (, or vegan butter (optional)
Approx 1/4 cup (60 ml) plant milk (, it must be unsweetened & unflavoured)
14 oz (400 grams) fettuccine (, (or other pasta of choice, gluten-free if necessary)

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pan of water to a boil and add the cauliflower. Cook for about 7 minutes or until fork tender. Don't overcook it as it will get watery. (You can steam it if you prefer).Drain and add to a blender or food processor.

While the cauliflower is cooking gently saut√© the onion for about 5 minutes until transparent then add the garlic and carry on cooking for one more minute. Remove from the heat and add to the blender along with the cauliflower.

Add all of the other sauce ingredients to the blender, EXCEPT the milk. The olive oil/butter is optional but makes the sauce glossier and richer if added. The miso is optional but helps cover up the cauliflower taste and adds umami cheesy flavour.

Blend until completely smooth. Once it's smooth, add the milk gradually a drop at a time until the sauce is the thickness you want. You might need slightly more or less than stated and you might need to do this in batches if your blender isn't big enough.
